content: On custom, with max difficulty this game truly shines, having to plot a path, avoid escorts which are extremely deadly makes this game a proper Das Boot experience n removes the arcade ambience that does it no justice.Removing auto aim n chart is recommended. Going on long range patrols then stalking n plotting a torpedos course is great. Only thing I'd change is the speed of the fast travel when on patrol, its way to rushed n fuel runs low way too fast. Its a submarine game, fast pace ruins it

This is really a super great game, but its hindered by a few problems that ruin a mission and game experience. As of writing this, consistent problems include the last ship all the sudden obtaining higher speed, usually after the 2nd to the last ship is destroyed, and it leaves the area fastet than you or your torpedoes can catch it. Torpedoes consistently miss their targets, (even the 1st target of the mission) on easy level. Enemy ships function and spin in an unrealistic manner in order to miss being hit... Please! At medium lvl and above, ships unrealistically avoid torpedoes, ignore decoys and make ridiculous spinning maneuvers (like a propeller or fan), and pass through other ships to come straight after you. Thanks for a great game, Scott! Please finish!
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback! Nothing should have changed with the torpedoes/targeting in the latest release, but maybe I introduced a bug. I'll investigate.
Regards, -Scott

content:
Love the game. The developer has been very attentive over an issues that 
arose. Recommend wholeheartedly to while away the time!

Submarine happiness. The random nature of the missions keeps the game fresh 
and the simple interface is functional. This game is immensely entertaining 
with huge replay value.

Game has always been challenging, well thought-out and addicting. Aside 
from that I think a good change to make would be to make the easy mode... 
Easy. Several times I have started on a new Patrol only to run into five or 
six escorts my first time out of the base. Easy should be easy, meaning 
either the convoys have no escorts or very lightly escorted one maybe two 
so you can get the real feel of the game. Torpedoes should be straight and 
true with very few malfunctions if any. In the easy mode , the Torpedoes 
should always hit their mark so many times you are shooting a torpedo dead 
at another vessel only for it to miss. The earlier versions did not seem to 
have this anomaly in the easy mode. Remember, this is the easy mode. Leave 
the more challenging modes for the moderate or Advanced groups. Thanks for 
a great game... Oh and would you separate the torpedo and deck gun buttons 
and put them farther from each other? Thanks again
replyContent:
Steve,
APKs of older versions can be downloaded from here: http://panicensuessoftware.com/CrashDive/downloads/

If you're having problems with the latest update, please shoot me an email at info@panicensuessoftware.com.
-Scott

content: This is a good arcade sub game reminiscent of the old Silent Hunter franchise. It's not really tactical, though. Ships can bounce off each other and I suspect the ai cheats; it seems to make a beeline for my sub after a torpedo attack even if I've changed direction and left the area underwater. But it's still fun to play in increments.
Purchased the game but it wants to be connected to the internet every so often or it will not let me play until I connect. Not a cool feature.

Im still trying to figure out why the game plays extremely‚Äã different between two exact same phones with the exact same software and updates with the exact same carrier? The only difference is the phone  number and account.  How does tiny pt boat or a destroyer go through an aircraft carrier and make it spin like Twister? How do to of any type of ship get stuck together and spin around in circles? How does a destroyer find a sub at a depth of over 220m ? Regardless how good the general public thinks the US new underwater radar was. No radar not even todays radar can find anything at that depth.  How long did it take them to find flight MH370? typical millennials to hard to ask the right questions.
replyContent: This is my new favorite conspiracy theory! Like most, it has zero basis in reality; but still, super entertaining, thank you!  -Scott

content: This is the best submarine combat game I've seen yet for Android. The only drawback is that it's based on the WWII u-boat. I would love to see a sequel based the 688i, with sonar and ADCAP torpedoes!

Easy format to get to grips with . The fact that you have a crew working for you , leaving you free to drive the boat and target , is way better than the games where you have to micro manage Every move . Worth the pennies , then some .

This has got to be the single best submarine action game app I have seen yet.  The action, graphics and sound (especially if you wear headphones while playing) are seriously beyond everything I can find for free or for pay.  If I could give six stars, I would.  ...  Wait a minute...  "‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ"  ...there!  To the makers of this game, is there any hope in the world that you might come out with a version in an American sub?  One can hope.  I repeat, "‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ!!!"

I love this game on my tablet, and it has driven me up the wall!!  One bug report, though -- sometimes during an encounter, I'll be tailing a 10 kt convoy, and for some reason I'll wind up unable to keep up with them at 19kts. I didn't accidentally kill off all the slow transports, either.  I'm chasing a Klickitat on the surface at 19 kts and he's still creeping away from me at 10 kts and getting away. I'm very confused by this bug.  Email sent regarding bug.
replyContent:
John, if you target the Klickitat, what does the ship info box show his speed as? You're right, you should be able to overtake that ship on the surface unless your engines are damaged.
-Scott

content: Could be better with more options to select different subs, and different torpedos. Faster load times on gun.overall a good game.

I love it when I try lite version. but when I buy full version and because the price not cheap, I have expectation it will be more fun like the other ship game I play for while (Pirate The Carribean).  After play for while, I am very dispointed.. The control rather annoying, when I do manuver sometime the ship don't move or very slow to take turn. When enemy detect torpedo trail or 1 target down, enemy ship always know where you location in an instan and you will be hunted, don't even bother to deploy decoy or how deep you dive. Only luck factor you can escape. when you escape, the target already far away.  Or your sub get damage from deep charge or get ram by enemy ship when no deep charge or ship near you. I look target from periscope, lock on torpedo and fire but sometime torpedo misses 45 degrees from target, sometime cannot lock on torpedo, it say "not in firing arc" but my sub it's inline with target. I don't understand about this. If I can demand refund, I will do it right now.
replyContent:
Hi Edoar,
The "beyond fire arc" warning means that, even if your sub is pointed directly at the enemy ship, due to the ship's speed the torpedo would need to launch at an intercept angle that is beyond 45 degrees.
If you would still like a refund, please email me your Google Play order # to info@panicensuessoftware.com. Thanks!  -Scott

I have to admit, I'm addicted to this Sim. However it is extremely frustrating to be doing extremely well,  then have the program cheat!!  Boats running through other boats... how does a corvette push a battleship out of the way.... or just pass straight through the ship...  how is it that when the player starts making great progress, the enemy can suddenly drop depth charges 1200m away, and kill you?  How is it that the enemy can turn a destroyer 180 degrees on a dime, but a sub can't turn on a dollar?
This isn't a cheesy knock off, it's a really good game. Well worth paying for.

I spend 3 hours a day travelling on trains, this sim has occupied most of this time for the last few months, it is just about starting to get a bit samey, could do with some different situations now but for what it cost it has been worth its weight in gold, note to developer, could we have some different boats to sink please... 5 stars all the way.

Hi guys...I would like to mentioned that sometimes, when the game starts, you can see all the boats for a split off a second (then they disappear) + when playing on SIM and having the periscope up I can see on the map all the CROSSES - boats, but I can't see them with periscope. And sometimes, when I manage to escape the attacking ships, they get stuck in the attacking mode and I can't DISENGAGE and I lose the patrol. Could this be sorted please?
replyContent: Hi Zdenek, thanks for the feedback! The X's are just estimates of ship positions, until you're close enough to see the ship in your periscope/chart view. If you can't disengage, you have to wait for the top-left timer to finish (green). Takes longer on higher difficulties. Please email me if you want more info.  -Scott, info@panicensuessoftware.com

Use LG GPad 10.1  . I play this excellent game the most. The latest update makes 8x 16x control unresponsive. The smaller escorts were able to push bigger ships aside in their sub chase! Please fix  soonest. Thanks

The previous version ran great on a note 4.  New version sucks memory at 8 and 16 speed it is extremely jerky and becomes unresponsive.  Turning while stopped is horribly slow now.  Individul ships turn randomly in medium and if I try to go under a ship at 200 ft, they turn away.  All I can think of right now.  Problems, please fix, I love this!
Great sub game if could upgrade sub now and again or six bow torps and two aft.  couple or more supply ships would not go a miss  perhaps adding a great deal could slow phone system down
I like the game, but as someone who travels a lot, I can't play it on a ship, a plane, or on a long ride through deadzones.  Kind of defeats the purpose of a "mobile" game.
replyContent:
Hi John,
Crash Dive uses your network connection for a license check the first time you run it; after that it only needs to connect about once a month, so you should be fine to use it while travelling.
-Scott

content: Great game. Graphics aren't as good as Atlantic Fleet though...
The best sub sim on android, best of all no continues buying extras one payment only
Great game.
Please add multiplayer

Although it appears I've lost having the app on my phone, your attentiveness to the customer earns you an additional star for a full 5-star rating. **Reply: Yes, but it's that functionality which is no longer working although it did on the original installation. I'm using Android 5.1.**
replyContent: Sorry I wasn't able to help you get it installed to SD. If you're not able to get the game working on your phone, please email your Google Play order # to info@panicensuessoftware.com and I'll refund your purchase. -Scott

content: Great game

This game is almost exactly what I was looking for.  It is extremely well executed in terms of visuals and complexity.  I'm not sure how historically accurate it is, but I think given the limitations of the game format (a phone) it is very detailed.  Clearly the best in class. Controls are well done with the only problem being a limitation of the size/form factor of my device (a Nexus 5).  I tried the Lite version and then pulled the trigger on the pay version.  Well worth it.
Brill if you played silent hunter you'll love this
Fantastic game. Reminds me a lot of Ubi Softs Silent Hunter 3. But it really needs a clock to tell you what time it is and a log on demand to see  enemy ships sunk.

This game costs almost $10 and you can't even upgrade to a better sub, or at least upgrade your current sub nor can you unlock diffrent weapons this makes the game very reppetitive however it has a lot of potential but with the state it is in right now I would not but it
Do you guys think you could make a u.s. submarine game with gato class subs? Have it take place in Pacific theater.
Would give five stars if i could play this without the need of an Internet connection. It would be so much fun on a train or long flight.
replyContent: Crash Dive uses your network connection for a license check the first time you run it; after that it only needs to connect about once a month,so you should be fine to use it while travelling.

Great game. Three things that would be improvements: 1. Enemy boats should not be able to go through other ships. 2. Timer should stay where advanced regardless of detection. 3. Sub should be difficult to detect when in other ships baffles. Like Silent Service was

You have the united States liner and only named it RMS MURATANIA..,..   The REAL RMS MURATANIA is A FOUR FUNNEL LINER!!!!!!!    REALLY?    I will re rate when you fix this. content: If you liked silent service back in the day you will love this. Very good indeed.
Great fun, reminiscent of the brilliant Silent Hunter series on the PC. Perhaps not strictly 100% accurate but still very immersive.
How about an allied version set in the Pacific
I just reinstalled it Great game
I love this game. It's the best I've found so far in this genre. I can live out my Red October fantasy.
What game could possibly be better to play while sitting on the captain's porcelain seat in a public restroom?

A throw back to the classic PC sims of old! Engaging balance of stealth and action and easy to pick up and play. Definitely worth buying. Immersion could be improved through hi resolution textures for the sea(in combat) and the addition of an exterior view of the sub.

The fact that escort ships can pass through each other without consequence really detracts from the game. The turning radius and acceleration of the ships puts them on par with some drug running speed boat. The patrol map can't be zoomed out to see resupply points. It's a great game, but could be substantially better with a little polish.

Great diversion after a long day, the only thing I don't like is how the escorts can sail through the cargo ships...also, I should be able to get in the baffles of large ship to reduce my sonar image...great game!
Thank you for this game you have great programers well worth it looking forward to more games from your company
Years ago there was a PC game called Gato. It ran on MS DOS. This Game reminds me of it. Fantastic Job.
If you are a fan of wwii sims try this game!  If you are a fan of Das Boot, Silent Hunter, or submarine warfare, definitely try this game!!
Money well spent subs need modification options and level up opportunity and multiple sorties and new unlock territories as well as the ability to play for different nations

So far it is the best sub sim for android. I would like to see a 688I for android.  Not a port from Jane's, but something fresh from an android experienced company such as Panic Ensues. I would love tracking contact via the sonar demon demon on my Nexus.
Just love to play this game. Best submarine game so far.

Kevin, sorry it's not working for you! Please contact me at info@panicensuessoftware.com to troubleshoot or arrange a full refund.

content: Far better than some you have to pay over the odds for. As with another review. Make it better by adding more nations to fight for etc.

The best Android Submarine Sim I've played yet!
FYI Designers, if I have limited torpedoes then destroyers have limited depth charges. PLUS, If I am running silent and sitting on the bottom I cannot be picked up on sonar.

This is one of the greatest games I have ever played on the app store, if not the greatest. No microtrandactions, attention to detail, and complex gameplay. I honestly didn't think you could fit so many features onto such a small touchscreen, but you somehow made it work. My one request is that you make the turns for the corvettes a tiny bit wider. Still, that's not enough to subtract a quarter of a star. 10/10
If there is a better sub game for Android I would be very surprised. This is simply excellent.
love this game
The game is challenging with a realistic feel as a phone can get
replyContent: Crash Dive does a license check every two weeks. If the check fails, the game will continue to work, but keep trying for another two weeks before displaying an error message. So essentially, you need to go online once a month when launching the game.

content: Awesome game
The tactics and game play are unparalleled. So simple and yet so complex. I fuggin love this game. GIVE US MULTIPLAYER.

I find myself playing this for hours. Its a thinking person's as you really have to create a plan of attack and and getaway plan.The graphics are great.
Game not too bad, but could not see how to play offline so no good for me.
replyContent: Hi Mark, the game will want to connect for a license check about once a month. Aside from that, you can play it offline.

replyContent: Thanks for the feedback! Those are two items that are on the list for a sequel.

content: ARE IN A COMA ZZZZZZZZZZZZZZ or simply can't be bothered anymore.
replyContent:
Martin,
Are the enemy ships disappearing from the Chart view or periscope view?
Torpedoes rise to the surface pretty quickly, so a torp fired from 10m away shouldn't pass under a ship unless it's right on top of you... in which case it wouldn't detonate anyways (torps only arm once 250m away).
Feel free to email me! info@panicensuessoftware.com

content: Wish there was a save game option. If you have to have break, it's not possible to continue. Start from beginning, otherwise, very good.

As has been said here plenty of times... Silent Hunter for your tablet. Great fun, just difficult enough to keep you coming back for more but not too difficult that you get disheartened. Nice mix of individual missions and a campaign mode too; well worth the money.

Brings back memories of the old Silent Service games / Silent Hunter.  First off when playing campaign you have to start on easy...which is extremely arcade-ish...and ladder up to unlock harder difficulties.  Once you hit the difficulty and make custom changes, that's when the game really shines.  As another reviewer wrote, the controls are very intuitive, but you will learn 1 or 2 things if you find an online guide / tips.  I am extremely impressed of how well this app is put together.    Pros:  Very easy to learn Very easy to get into a battle if just playing for 10-15 minutes.   So nostalgic to older great games.   Great visuals, immersive sound, good touch screen options, good tactics.   To anyone that complains about the cost of the app...it's cheaper than a movie ticket and I can see putting 100 hours into this sucker.   Cracking your 1st battleship or aircraft carrier and getting away on harder difficulties is nerve racking and awesome!!   Cons (all rather minor):  Ships passing through each other is kinda cheesy.   AI seems to always know where you are (I'll give that one to ya).   Small complaint...more variety of ships / classes.   Torpedo arc...thought they had gyros?
Sub sim
Reminds me of of my Silent Hunter days! Very good but corvettes cannot sail through other ships. Well done! Really enjoying it. Keep on developing it please!!!!!!!
Excellent reminds me of Silent Service II !!

Absolutley awesome...worth every penny paid for the full version....just one thing though...it would have been so much better if you could choose sides...i feel kinda quilty sending our navy to davey jone's locker :-)
Well thought out, smooth running, good graphics, enough of a challenge to keep it fun but not so hard you get frustrated.
Great App
Excellent fps. V good graphics, design. Only problem is always being German... no opportunity to fight for other countries. Who wants to be on the losing side?!!?
Excellent, keep up the good work.
Very realistic, good tutorial n campaign

This game exceeds my expectations. I love sub simulator games. I've always felt there's an intensity you don't get in any other genera, even space Sims. This game holds up extremely well against the competition, even more so when you take into account it's a mobile game. You may not get the same detail as a game like silent hunter 5, but it keeps the intensity with slightly simpler gameplay. Own it on HTC One and Lenovo tab
I realy like this app it makes you fill like you are the captain great work guys
A game that I had been looking for and it's great. I have no problems with recommending this game.
Well done

content: perfect

This game is a fun mix of submarine simulation and arcade-style gameplay. Desktop sim sailors will appreciate some nice touches of realism such as the map view, damage control and torpedo ranges. Straight gamers with less patience will like the cat-and-mouse game of evading destroyers and their depth charges, which get more accurate with higher difficulty levels. Also, the developer is VERY responsive, eager to please his customers and improve the game. Fun and well worth the money.

Fixed!!! Five stars all the way. The game does not load any further than that. I am using an Asus tablet with Android 4.2. Help or a refund would be appreciated
replyContent: Hi Reg, please email me at info@panicensuessoftware.com, and we'll see if we can get it working on your device, or give you a refund if not.  -Scott

If you installed the pay version, be aware that the game needs internet access.  It will prompt you that it needs to go online to verify your license.  It does this often not just once.  I ultimately had to uninstall my paid version as I don't go online often on my device.  If it can't go online then its unplayable.
replyContent: That is correct; it does a license check on first run, then about once a month after that.

I've been after a good U-Boat game on my tablet for ages; in this one I've found it! There's good instructions to get you started, but I'm someone who likes intuitive controls and this game has it. So if you want to get straight into the action ... You have the options of a single mission (good to get started on), patrols or campaigns; and all have options for different level of difficulty.  I had a spot of bother installing it from Google Play (their problem) so I contacted the developer who came back really quick with the solution - most impressive - great customer service. So, I'm delighted all round.
I was playing Crash Dive lite on my s5 and now I purchased the full game and it won't download. It stops at 89%. I would like a refund or a really quick fix. Please.
replyContent: Dwan, if the download is failing at the same point each time, it sounds like your device is out of storage space. Try freeing some space and trying again.

content: Played on easy, this is a quick arcade game; on sim, a really tough experience! If you've any interest in sub sims it's worth  a pop. Graphics are lovely and following a convoy with the sun setting was almost a powerful experience! Not quite PC levels of simulation, but great for a mobile game. In the top 2 of ww2 sub games that I've found on Play. As someone else mentioned, I would love enemy ships to avoid each other.  Currently they can happily pass through each other, which does break the immersion somewhat. Thoroughly recommended nethertheless

There's nothing like sneaking up inside an aircraft carrier group, torpedoing the pride n joy then diving deep and eluding the p*ssed off navy trying to get you for your dastardly deeds... sometimes they do though... oh well lucky  its a game.

Excellent game. Reminded me of those 3 am silent hunter escapes. What its 4 am.  Addicted again. Just one more end around attack. If you liked the old sub sims you will find this game right up your street.

I played the light version and couldnt get enough. Battles are very intense and can be difficult but is jaw clenching the whole time. By far my favorite app game and the only game i have ever payed for and well worth it. Very realistic
I don't buy games on here often. I'm glad I bought this one
Love it. it reminds me of silent hunter for the nes.

I very much love this simulator however the one problem I have that keeps me from giving you a 5-star rating is that the enemy ships can  "magically"  pass through each other while searching for or attacking my sub, but somehow manage to solidify when ramming my sub.  Please make all of the ships follow the laws of physics and I will gladly give a 5-star! Also, about every 5th battle, all of the surface ships disappear from view, but are still able to fire on my sub.  Please fix both the magical laws of physics AND the cloaking device ability of the surface fleets.

Hi Kyle,
Thanks for the feedback! The sub speed indicator is at the bottom right, just under the throttle controls.
-Scott

I just recently saw the epic movie Das Boot, and I had to find a good submarine game. This was the first I found, and I have no interest to look any further. content: Its a shame yur a german!! Make a english version!!!!!!

This game is exemplary.  No cash shop fleecing, no cow clicking, no energy bars (besides your phone/tablet's battery life).  Intuitive interface, multiple difficulty options, impressive visuals, randomized patrols and nail-biting tension combine to make for one heck of an experience.  Sacrifices had to be made in the realism department, but it's likely for the best.  Highly recommended, even if subsims aren't normally your thing.  Would love to see a sequel depicting the Silent Service in the Pacific.
Great game, only request I have is disabling the home button during play if it's possible.  I have left the game by mistake several times and upon relaunch all the progress had been lost.

Ive been a hardcore gamer since pong was released... i know my games. Ive played 3rd person sub games that were ok but honestly no sub game compares to this.my money was well spent i have no complaints just hope devs keep updating as they have.  Ive never been in the military but i feel like it when i play this game . WORTH EVERY CENT!!!  not hard to learn the controls and one of the best tutorial systems ive seen 20 stars. Good work devs u really did it this time.
Nice 3D game
Need to make this game for the PC , recently, I have a problem everytime I surface during the battle I'm being depth charged but there's no boats around can you fix this problem
Amazingly detailed sub sim

Great sim, well worth the small cost. looking forward to the new update. Great for filling in those long flight's ;) Pretty good AI. Enjoy. Only complaint is you can't save you scores for posting at a later date.  Also some fine tuning of the enemy ships needs doing, real ships can't change direction or speed as fast as these do. But great game even with  few small real world physics errors in the modeling. Hopefully this game will be evolved with further updates.

content: A great title.  Accessible mobile interface: not too complex but enough depth for strategy on the go. Takes me back to the golden gaming days of Hunter Killer etc. Well worth the price for hours of gaming. Drop into a quick mission or do the full war patrol. Great tutorials to get you started as well. Up periscope!
Its simple once you get the hang of it and the difficulty levels ramp up the danger. For a mobile game this is awesome.  Really entertaining and emersive.
Great but please fix allied ships ability to steam through each other and their cargo ships and depth charge you at the same time
Tidy
About as close as you can get to the PC classic "Aces of the Deep" on tablets.  Some quibbles, but nothing major.
Good
If you are a fan of submarine simulations, this is vintage heaven. Only slight criticism is the turning & diving speeds being too fast.

Been playing subsims since Silent Service and SIlent Hunter 1, in fact still enjoying that game! This one is really what it promises, a beautiful game in every respect. No real flaws and first rate help from the dev when you have an issue. My only beef is the unrealistic speed and maneuverability of the ships - accelerating from 2 knots to 20 knots in less than 3 seconds to dodge a torpedo is simply too much. Also, a Destroyer running at 18 knots making a hard-over turn would throw the crew around like rag dolls. I do like the new patrol using resupply to determine length, works great. A career mode would be great, possibly bringing in crew development and different sub types as well. And why do the Germans get all the fun?! The U-Boats are fun and all but I'm holding out for my Gato class to hunt Japanese shipping. Thank you very much for a great game! I would give six stars but they won't let me...
Good sub sim with great graphics. Massive potential

The other issue is how do I know where all of the supply ships are? Is there a way to view out? The game crashes when I'm on very long patrols and I can't get back into my game.
replyContent: Nate, Does the sub try to surface even when the Dive button is green? Please email me at info@panicensuessoftware.com with more info.  In the map view, the last known position, and current estimated position of all enemy ships (based on their speed/heading when last seen) is marked with an 'X' and an indicator line pointing from your sub.

this is the best sim I have ever seen. I have tried them all definitely 5 stars

content: Great game and I enjoy it and thank you Scott, for replying quickly. It was due to the app being moved to the external SD, card while the other half stayed on the device storage. Make sure the game is on the device storage not the external storage. Or save games corrupt could happen it did for me. Feels like Silent Hunter, was put on mobile and very user friendly controls. Defintely a game to get and one of the few I payed money for.
replyContent: Please make sure your SD card isn't full; if that's not the problem, zip up the files that are in SDCard\data\com.PanicEnsuesSoftware.CrashDive and email them to info@panicensuessoftware.com, and I'll try and debug it. Thanks! -Scott

content: Really nice sub game
Very glad about this one.

Crash Dive does not have crewmen, a captain's bunk, or planes, but then again, it costs a mere $6. If you ever played Aces, or if you read about the simple fun of the early subsims, how can you pass on Crash Dive? This is an excellent game that offers engaging U-boat gameplay built on a visually appealing base with solid AI and first-rate controls.   The game interface is clustered with finely detailed controls to manage your U-boat. During a battle there are three main screens: the navigation chart, periscope view, and bridge view. While on the bridge you can use binoculars/UZO to target ships. The controls are well thought-out. Changing depth is done in 50m increments, you can shift the boat to view with a click, er... touch. Torpedoes can be fired individually or in a spread of three. When your U-boat takes damage, small report banners pop up.  Since the wave of mobile and iPad platform games, I've played more than a few naval titles, some of them quite good. Panic Ensues has crafted a game that satisfies the yearning for a good subsim and reestablishes the allure of North Atlantic convoy combat in a way that does Aces of the Deep, Silent Service, and Grey Wolf proud.
Similiar to silent hunter, i liked it, thank you developer for this game. Worth the money.

The best sub warfare game yet!
Needs oxygen meter and a mission builder.

This game is remarkable for a cheap mobile app. It has the perfect blend between arcade fun and realistic simulation. With the quick mission mode you can pick up and play, or for a longer experience try the war patrol mode. With each difficulty, background is given, and many real tactics used in WWII are modelled in the game. It pretty much stoked my interest in submarine simulators. What a gem to find in the depths of the Play Store. Fantastic!
Great game, very fun. I do wish there was a point system to buy upgrades for the submarine though...
Ok great , beautiful. Good work guys. A how ever the torp could use a better explosion. But other then that it's. A 4.5 4 and a half not bad.

This game is pretty close to being Silent Hunter III filed down until it fits on a tablet. To be fair, a good few bits were lost, but the game still feels right.  My finest moment to date involves torpedoing a pair of cargo ships, fleeing on the surface, diving once I come under fire, evading my pursuers, and then, while they are still depth-charging the area they think I am in, surfacing and starting my end-run around the convoy for another attack run.
Best sub game I have found yet!

content: This game is fantastic, I spent many hours playing and managed to get 1st place on the leaderboards for all the difficulty levels :^) But I would love to see two improvements: 1. Fix the bug that makes the game too easy - when you shoot the deck gun at a transport from beyond their view range (1800-2000) and escort gun range (2500) all the escorts get alerted but will go to the place you were last spotted (for example where you fired a torpedo). Then you can finish all the transports with the deck gun. Generally deck gun should only be effective to finish off targets damaged by torpedoes, not to sink a battleship :^) 2. Add campaign mode, achievements, bigger map (with variable water depth), historical technology improvements (radar, decoys, better submarines etc)

I can't say enough good things about this app! I love every bit of it. I've been playing sub simulators since Silent Service first came out in the 80s and I can say without a doubt, this is one of the best on the market. Very comparable to Silent Hunter as well. I thoroughly LOVE this game. You will too.
Would be nice if there were upgrades that could be earned.  Also want a campaign mode.

The gui could be more immersive and I wish the convoys would actually move on the map. It's too easy to encounter them. I also wish you could order silent running for the ship. Along with era- appropriate artwork and design would definitely raise the bar for this title.
